comments.author: Shmalimoo Ftw

comments.text:
1. Love: What you feel for your parents, siblings, and best friends.
2. Attraction: That jump in heart rate when you see an attractive person.
3. Lust: The urge to sexually involve yourself with someone.

Society's definition of love is number two and three combined.

Myth: Love at first sight.
Truth: Attraction and/or lust at first sight.
Myth: Falling in love with someone.
Truth: Accepting the fact that your genetics like someone else's genetics. 

Love actually takes time and requires no aspect of sexual tension. Your 
love for your parents/siblings/best friends doesn't involve passionate 
kisses and sex does it? Yes, I'm aware there are the typical weirdos/trolls 
that prowl the youtube comment sections who'll beg to differ. Please don't 
respond if you're one.

There's nothing wrong with number 2 and 3, only, it's prudent to keep in 
mind that on their own they don't create a successful relationship or 
marriage. Love is an essential backbone that is more often than not lacking 
in nowadays average relationship, and I think that's why you see a lot of 
divorces.﻿

comments.text:
I'm sorry but the "love at first sight" thing is bullcrap, it is more 
described as lust. Let's compare two scenarios:
-You are having dinner with a good friend of yours and suddenly they have 
cardiac arrest and die right on the spot.
-You see someone across the room, you experience "Love at first sight", 
they have cardiac arrest and die right on the spot.

Are you seriously going to tell me that in both situations your anguish 
would be even close to similar?﻿

I don't believe in love at first sight. It's a really cute idea but I don't

I mean, you don't know anything about them. "Knowing their the right 
partner" is not the same thing as truly loving them. I believe in 
infatuation at first sight. But not love. I believe you can fall in love 
fairly quickly, but I don't think it would be at first sight. Btw: I'm very 
in love with the idea of love. Romance tragedy and rom/coms are my thing. 
So I'm not just some scroogy person who thinks love is stupid. I just think 
love needs to be real. Haha﻿

comments.text:
Love at first sight is true. The way it works is by the pheromones. The 
brain seeks connections with people who have the best genes to mix with 
your genes. When it smells the right pheromones it sends out dopamine and 
you start getting symptoms like faster heartbeat, sweaty hands, and you 
feel butterflies in your stomach. It's not lust either. It doesn't matter 
if they're good looking or not the fact that they make you feel good is 
going to attract you to them. It's actually going to be hard to ignore 
them. To you they will seem like the best looking person in the world. But 
other people may not agree at all. If you haven't felt this then you have 
not fallen in love.﻿

comments.author: Snappers-snoop

comments.text:
I never believed in love at first sight... but it actually happend to me. I 
spent some time reading most of the comments and I do agree with both the 
scientist and the spirituals. I know love is a mix of substances in our 
brain and in our body, and that it can mean a lot of thigs. Acording to 
psichology, true love is "all of them" : lust, appreciation, devotion, 
respect and the list cand go on and on. But if it was only that, it could 
easily be labeled as a simple mix of feelings like friendship. In my 
opinion, love is something more than that, and I don't refer to love 
strictly in a boyfriend-girlfriend relationship. A good example of TRUE 
LOVE at first sight, when you know absolutely nothing about the person you 
see, is when you are born. Your parents love you at first sight, they love 
you even before your birht, before seeing you for the first time. So do 
you. 
So why would the boyfriend-girlfriend love be diffrent? We imagine a more 
or less definite idea of our ideal, of the person we want to be with the 
rest of our lives, so basicly we start to love them even before meeting 
them. 
I am in a relationship for 2 1/2 years and I can say it was love at first 
sight. We were in a crowd and somehow we both noticed each other, we were 
literaly staring in each others eyes like retards. The next thing that came 
to my mind was "He must be the father of my children". we didn't talk for 3 
months because we didn't know each other but then we met again and that is 
when our relationship started. I knew I love him when I saw him and so did 
he. If that is not love at first sight, I don't know what it is.﻿
comments.author: Alexandra Cimpean

comments.text:
nobody falls in love with your personality from the first sight. deal with
